results.title: Hills of home
results.creator_credit: Fred M Wilcox, Robert Sisk and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Starring everybody’s favourite dog, Lassie, this entertaining and enjoyable family film centres around a remote Scottish village and its only doctor (played by Edmund Gwenn) who decides to adopt Lassie. However unbeknownst to the doctor, Lassie has an aversion to water and even though the good doctor patiently tries to work her through this fear, it is not until Lassie is put to the test of saving the doctor’s life that the fear is finally overcome. Cast also includes Janet Leigh and Tom Drake.

results.title: Gremlins
results.creator_credit: Joe Dante, Michael Finnell, Kathleen Kennedy, Frank Marshall, Steven Spielberg, Warner Bros Pictures and Amblin Entertainment
results.brief_description: Billy Peltzer’s father buys him a new cuddly pet. But heed these three warnings: Don’t ever get him wet. Keep him away from bright light. And the most important thing, the one thing you must never forget: no matter how much he cries, no matter how much he begs…never, never feed him after midnight. Cast includes Zach Galligan, Phoebe Cates, Hoyt Axton, Polly Holliday, Frances Lee McCain.

results.title: Night of dark shadows
results.brief_description: Adapted from the television series “Dark shadows” this film tells the story of artist Charles Collins and his new wife, and of things that go bump in the night. After moving into his recently inherited family mansion, Collins begins to experience strange dreams - dreams of the past, dreams that suddenly are not dreams any more. Will he follow the same path as his family before? Cast includes David Selby, Monica Rich, Christopher Pennock, Lara Parker, Grayson Hall, Diana Millay.

results.title: Follow that bird
results.creator_credit: Ken Kwapis, Tony Garnett and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Big Bird goes to stay with the Dodo family in Illinois, but soon realizes he really belongs with the variety of inhabitants on Sesame Street. Adapted from the very popular children’s television series, “Sesame Street”, this wonderful muppet film features Oscar, Bert, Ernie, Cookie Monster and many of the other loved characters from the television show. Delightful entertainment for all the family. Stars Chevy Chase, Sandra Bernhard, Waylon Jennings, Dave Thomas and John Candy in cameo roles and the voices of Carroll Spinney, Jim Henson, Frank Oz, Paul Bartel and others.

results.title: The Barretts of Wimpole Street
results.creator_credit: Sidney A. Franklin, Sam Zimbalist and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A dramatic portrayal of the romance of poets, Elizabeth Barrett (Jennifer Jones) and Robert Browning (Bill Travers). The invalid poetess who regains her health after falling in love with the famous poet elopes with the poet against the wishes of her tyrannical father (John Gielgud), who exhibits an incestuous attachment for Elizabeth, as well as an over domineering control of all the Barrett siblings in their personal adult relationships. The story is set in London, England, starting in the year, 1845. Cast also includes Virginia McKenna, Susan Stephen, Vernon Gray.

results.title: Look both ways
results.creator_credit: Sarah Watt, Bridget Ikin, Hibiscus Films and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: Sarah Watt’s feature film “Look both ways” is a highly unusual but most engaging narrative about death, grief and foreboding. Meryl (Justine Clarke), a talented artist who paints greeting cards for a living, she sees death and disaster everywhere she looks. These dire visions are amusingly presented in animated visions of her art work. When Meryl meets Nick there is the hope of romance; but Nick’s is saddled with his own bad news. Around these two, numerous characters swirl with an array of crisis’ to conquer.

results.title: Jindabyne
results.creator_credit: Ray Lawrence, Catherine Jarmar and April Films
results.brief_description: Based on the Raymond Carver short story “So much water so close to home”, this is a compelling drama about a marriage drawn asunder by a young girl’s murder. Stewart Kane, played by Irish actor Gabrielle Byrne, goes fishing with friends to a remote spot; when he and his friends find a young girl’s mutilated body they continue with their trip, reporting the crime upon their return. Such callousness makes Claire (Laura Linney) question her marriage and her husband’s humanity and she is drawn into a web of intrigue and ethical dilemmas. Expanding upon Carver’s original text, Lawrence examines Aboriginal rites and ceremonies and places, central to the narrative, the uncomfortable relationship between the black and white communities.

constellations_other.name: The ‘Australian' alps
constellations_other.description: These feature films and documentaries show how stories have been told to lay claim - and reclaim - the land and our national identity.

results.title: My man Godfrey (1957)
results.creator_credit: Henry Koster, Ross Hunter and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: This remake of the classic 1936 screwball comedy, stars June Allyson in the key role of the kooky heiress who falls for her butler. David Niven plays the apparently impoverished butler, employed by a wealthy, if decidedly eccentric family. Once immersed in their employ, Godfrey’s presence causes endless turmoil, firstly when Irene falls hopelessly in love with him, and secondly when her jealous sister tries to frame him for theft. Set in Depression-era America, this is a delightfully light-hearted comedy that also comments on the importance of compassion. Based on the novel by Eric Hatch.

results.title: The Life story of John Lee, or, The Man they could not hang
results.creator_credit: Arthur W Sterry, Frederich Haldane and Sterry and Haldane
results.brief_description: This story is about an Englishman, John Lee, who in 1885 escaped the gallows after being convicted of murder, because three times the trapdoor failed to work. After many years in prison a dying woman’s confession finally clears Lee of the murder. Although supposedly based on fact it seems likely that the silent film versions were based on a play performed in Australia in 1912. The success of the first film version (now lost) made in the same year led the distributors Haldane and Sherry to produce a new version in 1921 expanding the story to include scenes from Lee’s happy childhood. Piety and intensity of emotion are emphasised and the film is at times crudely sentimental. Despite negative reviews the remake was again very successful with the public. Raymond Longford remade the story as a talkie in 1934; this third version has also been lost. Cast includes Rose Rooney, David Edelsten Cinematography by Tasman G. Higgins. Silent film with intertitles.

results.title: Greenhide
results.creator_credit: Charles Chauvel and Australian Film Productions
results.brief_description: Out of boredom, a high society girl visits her father’s outback cattle station. After several adventures involving a gang of ruthless cattle duffers, she falls in love with the manager of the station. Cast includes Elsie Sylvaney, Bruce Gordon, Jules Murray-Prior, Irma Deardon, Frank thorn, alfred Greenup, Gerald Barlow. Silent film with intertitles.
